channel.title: The Conversion [317-508] [Revised] [Update]
channel.description:
Updated text for this post.
Ok, for those who are new reading this, lets re-cap...
I am working on a 317-508 client, it basically will be a 317 with a 508 cover. Meaning that you will have 508 npc's and 508 items and 508 objects on a 317 server.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~MY PROGRESS~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Seperate models into different folders - 100%
Learn basic adding int's - 100%
Add all 508 items - 87% (close to done, but i ran further and grabbed 525 items)
Add all 508+ NPC's - 34% (I added most of them, just they turn invisible at log in)
Add all 508+ Models - 0% (take a project one step at a time, this isn't one of my priorities)
Add new/custom animations 74% - (added the correct ones, adding my own now)
Add a J-Frame - 0% - (as I said, one step at a time)
Add a conversion from the 317-508 to 508-317 - 100% (maybe you cant withstand hi-def)
Add a web-client for all to use - 0% (Don't understand any one's tut's probably ask someone to do it for me)
Add new interfaces - 0% (Didn't understand supra s tutorial, and don't care)
Add new 508 map data - 100% (Kinda got confused at first, but i fixed the glitch's)
this is my overall progress, I'm shooting for web-client to be released in 2 months, then everyone can use...My main priority here for web-client is 2 versions.
V1: Usable for my server, custom animations and such that wont lag you off on my server but will on others
V2: Usable for any server that's 317 just gives you a better graphics and game play experience
V1 - 57% - no web-client yet plus still working
V2 - 87% - no web-client yet
For those who are concerned if this is real, if I find a way to make the NPC'S visible same with items, i can post some pics for everyone.
:)
hope you enjoy
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~CREDITS~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Client base - delta
Client Workers - Me, Sterling
Client Testers - Me, Sterling, Server players
Tutorials - Silent Cj, GalkonsPride, Supra s
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~LAST MESSAGE~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
We hope that you get excited about this project, because after this I bet you'll think Jagex was stupid for doing a total client and server conversion.

item.title: The Conversion [317-508] [Revised] [Update]
item.dc:creator: @dragmagic dragmagic
item.description:
@dragmagic wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:25, topic:255061”][quote author=GalkonsPride link=topic=337030.msg2621867#msg2621867 date=1231515612]
Okay. Several flaws in this project of yours.

Animations: importing HD animations to a 317 client will be nearly impossible without rewriting the animation class. Each animation/frame is held in its own format, much like the 3d models in the client. They are all held in data files, but they are Jagex’s own format, therefor, we have nothing but our own minds to work with them.

Models: the models are written in a new model format commonly labeled as .mdl, short for model. It is easy to get a client to load the new model header, as it has been released. If you don’t have the release, just rewrite it yourself so it loads the polygons[triangles], colors, etc.

NPC’s: good luck with getting HD NPC’s working. 100% of the new NPC’s have animations not supported by the client, which IMPORTING the new animations would cause the client to crash. They also will be invisible without the new model header.

Items: about 90% of the items will not work in game because of several factors. One, is that if you don’t get the new model header working, you won’t get any items working. Another, is the animations they are given are different from the standard 317 animations. Also, almost ALL the models would be fucked if you are aiming for an HD client. Wanna know why?

Because HD loads new textures and details onto each individual model, making the detail of much higher quality. There are several classes in a 508+ client devoted to this factor only. A 317 client will not have the ability to load new textures of these details onto over 15000 models[more if you’re aiming for more models].

Between the factors of textures, animations, formats, you’re basically screwed unless you rebuild the client itself, which basically has no point.
[/quote]
Thank you, I’m not the only smart person around…[/quote]well if we dont import all the animation all of the body models stil usethe same animation so we will be good for most of it and some people have imported all of the animation they extracted it from 508 cache like everything else

Read full topic

Only Problem is that because there are over 40k models Windows might struggle the keep them together and who take AGES to compress and de-compress.

I totally agree, I think the main problem is saving over thousands .gzip files in one directory will seriously decrease the Hosting Computers performance. I’ve heard you can store 65, 535 files from memory so theres no real concern.

item.title: The Conversion [317-508] [Revised] [Update]
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“GalkonsPride, post:24, topic:255061”]Okay. Several flaws in this project of yours.

Animations: importing HD animations to a 317 client will be nearly impossible without rewriting the animation class. Each animation/frame is held in its own format, much like the 3d models in the client. They are all held in data files, but they are Jagex’s own format, therefor, we have nothing but our own minds to work with them.

Models: the models are written in a new model format commonly labeled as .mdl, short for model. It is easy to get a client to load the new model header, as it has been released. If you don’t have the release, just rewrite it yourself so it loads the polygons[triangles], colors, etc.

NPC’s: good luck with getting HD NPC’s working. 100% of the new NPC’s have animations not supported by the client, which IMPORTING the new animations would cause the client to crash. They also will be invisible without the new model header.

Items: about 90% of the items will not work in game because of several factors. One, is that if you don’t get the new model header working, you won’t get any items working. Another, is the animations they are given are different from the standard 317 animations. Also, almost ALL the models would be fucked if you are aiming for an HD client. Wanna know why?

Because HD loads new textures and details onto each individual model, making the detail of much higher quality. There are several classes in a 508+ client devoted to this factor only. A 317 client will not have the ability to load new textures of these details onto over 15000 models[more if you’re aiming for more models].

Between the factors of textures, animations, formats, you’re basically screwed unless you rebuild the client itself, which basically has no point.[/quote]
Thank you, I’m not the only smart person around…

Read full topic

item.title: The Conversion [317-508] [Revised] [Update]
item.dc:creator: @GalkonsPride GalkonsPride
item.description:
@GalkonsPride wrote:

Okay. Several flaws in this project of yours.

Animations: importing HD animations to a 317 client will be nearly impossible without rewriting the animation class. Each animation/frame is held in its own format, much like the 3d models in the client. They are all held in data files, but they are Jagex’s own format, therefor, we have nothing but our own minds to work with them.

Models: the models are written in a new model format commonly labeled as .mdl, short for model. It is easy to get a client to load the new model header, as it has been released. If you don’t have the release, just rewrite it yourself so it loads the polygons[triangles], colors, etc.

NPC’s: good luck with getting HD NPC’s working. 100% of the new NPC’s have animations not supported by the client, which IMPORTING the new animations would cause the client to crash. They also will be invisible without the new model header.

Items: about 90% of the items will not work in game because of several factors. One, is that if you don’t get the new model header working, you won’t get any items working. Another, is the animations they are given are different from the standard 317 animations. Also, almost ALL the models would be fucked if you are aiming for an HD client. Wanna know why?

Because HD loads new textures and details onto each individual model, making the detail of much higher quality. There are several classes in a 508+ client devoted to this factor only. A 317 client will not have the ability to load new textures of these details onto over 15000 models[more if you’re aiming for more models].

Between the factors of textures, animations, formats, you’re basically screwed unless you rebuild the client itself, which basically has no point.

Read full topic

@wolfs_goal wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:20, topic:255061”][quote author=wolfs goal link=topic=337030.msg2620461#msg2620461 date=1231356240]

You just open the folder you want to put to mqo with the datmaker, then select a model, go to file > Convert > MQO.
You have to do that for all the individual models, it doesn’t convert them all in one click.

sadly when i use my dat maker with a .dat file it says “cannot read this file type.”
[/quote]

OBVIOUSLY, you haven’t done this part yet then.

Add all 508 items - 87% (close to done, but i ran further and grabbed 525 items)

Add all 508+ NPC’s - 34% (I added most of them, just they turn invisible at log in)

Add new/custom animations 74% - (added the correct ones, adding my own now)

Add a conversion from the 317-508 to 508-317 - 100% (maybe you cant withstand hi-def)[/quote]

yes, i added all the int’s all items work, its just they turn you invisible…

npc’s work, they just turn invisible…

objects work, they just turn invisible…

animations work, they just turn invisible sometimes.

thats why im looking for a .dat-.mqo converter.

if i had one it would be way easier…

oh btw…

my models folder imports off another models folder on my computer…

so yeh…
my client is only like…15mb
